Sequence Information.Peptide Name: OaBac7.5mini (natural AMPs; Minibactenecin; mammals, animals; Pro-rich; PrAMPs, XXA, UCLL1c)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (54.55%) toTur1AThis is the actual isolated form, which corresponds to residues 32-60 of intact OcBac7.5.Activity:  Active against Gram- E. coli O157:H7, 0111, or UB1005; rough K-12 strain (MIC 8-32 ug/ml), S. enterica serovar Typhimurium 14028s (MIC 32 ug/ml), S. enterica serovar Typhimurium MS4252S (phoPQ mutant; defensin supersusceptible) (MIC 2 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa PAO1, or Z61, antibiotic-supersusceptible mutant (MIC 16-32 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aureus NCTC 4163 or MRSA R147 (MIC 32-64 ug/ml or greater), S. epidermidis clinical isolate (MIC 32 ug/ml), E. faecalis ATCC 29212 (MIC 64 ug/ml), and yeast . C. albicans 105 or 3153A (MIC 64 ug/ml or greater) (PubMed).Antimicrobial robustness: salt-insensitive: Its antibacterial actitivity against E. coli 0157:H7 and C. albicans 3153A are retained in the presence of 100 mM NaCl, better than OaBac5 (Anderson and Yu, 2003.
Literature Information.Author: Anderson RC, Yu PL. 2003
Literature Information.Reference: Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 2003 Dec 26;312(4):1139-46. doi: 10.1016/j.bbrc.2003.11.045.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and characterisation of proline/arginine-rich cathelicidin peptides from ovine neutrophils
